page.title: 12Uyeasound Flowers.
page.content: In school we decided to see which were the first 10 flowers to bloom in Uyeasound in Spring.We started to look in May as flowers were beginning to appear. First we found a celandine in sheltered,rough grassland.Then we found a dandelion and a daisy in the school playground.Next in boggy grassland we found a marsh marigold,followed by a bluebell on a grassy bank.Later we found a primrose in a grassy bank,then in another grassy bank we found a dog violet. Above the shoreline on a grassy bank we next found a red campion.The last two to be found were spring squill in damp grassland and lady's smock also in damp grass. We sent our list to the Shetland Field Studies Group to compare with other Shetland schools.
